getNormal_tria6.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /******************************************************************************
00002 * File      : getNormal_tria6.c                                               *
00003 * Author    : Carlos Rosales Fernandez (carlos@ihpc.a-star.edu.sg)            *
00004 * Date      : 01-09-2006                                                      *
00005 * Revision  : 1.0                                                             *
00006 *******************************************************************************
00007 * DESCRIPTION                                                                 *
00008 * Returns the unit normal[] vector at the point nNodeID. The average normal   *
00009 * is used if the node is shared by several elements.                          *
00010 * Works for quadratic interpolation in triangular elements (6-noded triangles)*
00011 ******************************************************************************/
00012 
00013 /******************************************************************************
00014 * COPYRIGHT & LICENSE INFORMATION                                             *
00015 *                                                                             *
00016 * Copyright 2006 Carlos Rosales Fernandez and The Institute of High           *
00017 * Performance Computing (A*STAR)                                              *
00018 *                                                                             *
00019 * This file is part of depSolver.                                             *

00022 * it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by        *

00024 * (at your option) any later version.                                         *
00025 *                                                                             *
00026 * depSolver is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,                *
00027 * but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of              *
00028 * MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the               *
00029 * GNU General Public License for more details.                                *
00030 *                                                                             *
00031 * You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License           *
00032 * along with depSolver; if not, write to the Free Software                    *
00033 * Foundation, Inc., 51 Franklin St, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA  02110-1301  USA  *
00034 ******************************************************************************/
00035 
00036 #include <stdio.h>
00037 #include <stdlib.h>
00038 #include <math.h>
00039 
00040 /* Global variables */
00041 extern unsigned int nElems;
00042 
00043 int getNormal_tria6(unsigned int nNodeID, double **mNodes, 
00044                     unsigned int **mElems, double *normal)
00045 {
00046     const unsigned int NODES_IN_ELEM = 6;
00047     unsigned int i, j, nIsInElem;
00048     int nCurrentElem, nNodePosition;
00049     double ax, ay, az, dx1, dx2, dy1, dy2, dz1, dz2, L1, L2, normalmod;
00050     double tmp[3];
00051     double X[6][3];
00052 
00053     /* Initialize */
00054     tmp[0] = tmp[1] = tmp[2] = 0.0;
00055     nIsInElem = 0;
00056     nCurrentElem = -1;
00057     nNodePosition = -1;
00058 
00059     /* Loop through all elements and average their normals at nNodeID */
00060     do{
00061         
00062         /* Find element containing the evaluation point nNodeID */
00063         for(i = nCurrentElem+1; i < nElems; i++){ 
00064             for(j = 0; j < NODES_IN_ELEM; j++){
00065                 if(mElems[i][j] == nNodeID) {
00066                     nCurrentElem = i;
00067                     nNodePosition = j;
00068                     nIsInElem = 1;
00069                     break;
00070                     }
00071             }
00072             if(nIsInElem) break;
00073         }
00074 
00075         if(nIsInElem){
00076             
00077             /* (L1,L2) for evaluation point in this element */
00078             if(nNodePosition == 0){
00079                 L1 = 1.0;
00080                 L2 = 0.0;
00081             }
00082             else if(nNodePosition == 1){
00083                 L1 = 0.5;
00084                 L2 = 0.5;
00085             }
00086             else if(nNodePosition == 2){
00087                 L1 = 0.0;
00088                 L2 = 1.0;
00089             }
00090             else if(nNodePosition == 3){
00091                 L1 = 0.0;
00092                 L2 = 0.5;
00093             }
00094             else if(nNodePosition == 4){
00095                 L1 = 0.0;
00096                 L2 = 0.0;
00097             }
00098             else{
00099                 L1 = 0.5;
00100                 L2 = 0.0;
00101             }
00102 
00103             /* Get coordinates of nodes of this element */
00104             for(j = 0; j < NODES_IN_ELEM; j++){
00105                 X[j][0] = mNodes[mElems[nCurrentElem][j]-1][0];
00106                 X[j][1] = mNodes[mElems[nCurrentElem][j]-1][1];
00107                 X[j][2] = mNodes[mElems[nCurrentElem][j]-1][2];
00108             }
00109 
00110             /* Auxiliar quantities */
00111             ax = X[1][0] - X[3][0] + X[4][0] - X[5][0];
00112             ay = X[1][1] - X[3][1] + X[4][1] - X[5][1];
00113             az = X[1][2] - X[3][2] + X[4][2] - X[5][2];
00114 
00115             /* Derivatives of (x,y,z) with respect to L1 and L2 */
00116             dx1 = 4.0*(L1*(X[0][0] + X[4][0] - 2.0*X[5][0]) + L2*ax + X[5][0]) - X[0][0] - 3.0*X[4][0];
00117             dx2 = 4.0*(L1*ax + L2*(X[2][0] + X[4][0] - 2.0*X[3][0]) + X[3][0]) - X[2][0] - 3.0*X[4][0];
00118             dy1 = 4.0*(L1*(X[0][1] + X[4][1] - 2.0*X[5][1]) + L2*ay + X[5][1]) - X[0][1] - 3.0*X[4][1];
00119             dy2 = 4.0*(L1*ay + L2*(X[2][1] + X[4][1] - 2.0*X[3][1]) + X[3][1]) - X[2][1] - 3.0*X[4][1];
00120             dz1 = 4.0*(L1*(X[0][2] + X[4][2] - 2.0*X[5][2]) + L2*az + X[5][2]) - X[0][2] - 3.0*X[4][2];
00121             dz2 = 4.0*(L1*az + L2*(X[2][2] + X[4][2] - 2.0*X[3][2]) + X[3][2]) - X[2][2] - 3.0*X[4][2];
00122 
00123             /* Normal components and modulus (inverted) */
00124             normal[0] = dy1*dz2 - dy2*dz1;
00125             normal[1] = dx2*dz1 - dx1*dz2;
00126             normal[2] = dx1*dy2 - dx2*dy1;
00127             normalmod = 1.0/sqrt(normal[0]*normal[0] + normal[1]*normal[1] + normal[2]*normal[2]);
00128 
00129             /* Gunit normal */
00130             normal[0] = normal[0]*normalmod;
00131             normal[1] = normal[1]*normalmod;
00132             normal[2] = normal[2]*normalmod;
00133 
00134             /* Add contribution to average normal */
00135             tmp[0] += normal[0];
00136             tmp[1] += normal[1];
00137             tmp[2] += normal[2];
00138 
00139             /* Reset flag */
00140             nIsInElem = 0;
00141         }
00142     }while(i < nElems);
00143     
00144     /* Modulus of the average normal (inverted) */
00145     normalmod = 1.0/sqrt(tmp[0]*tmp[0] + tmp[1]*tmp[1] + tmp[2]*tmp[2]);
00146 
00147     /* Get unit average normal */
00148     normal[0] = tmp[0]*normalmod;
00149     normal[1] = tmp[1]*normalmod;
00150     normal[2] = tmp[2]*normalmod;
00151 
00152     return 0;
00153 }
